pli-tv-kd10:0.4.eng: 1. The account of the dispute at Kosambī

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-kd10:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.1.2.eng: a certain monk had committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.3.eng: He regarded it as an offense,

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.4.pli: aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.1.4.eng: but there were other monks who did not.

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.5.pli: So aparena samayena tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti;
pli-tv-kd10:1.1.5.eng: Some time later he no longer regarded it as an offense,

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.6.pli: aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.1.6.eng: but there were other monks who did.

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.8.eng: “You’ve committed an offense. Do you recognize it?”

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.9.eng: “No, I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize.”

pli-tv-kd10:1.1.10.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū sāmaggiṃ labhitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:1.1.10.eng: Soon afterwards the monks achieved unanimity, and they ejected that monk for not recognizing the offense.

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.1.pli: So ca bhikkhu bahussuto hoti āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd10:1.2.1.eng: But that monk was learned, a master of the tradition; he was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:1.2.2.eng: He went to his friends and said,

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.4.eng: and so I haven’t committed any.

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.6.eng: for the legal procedure was illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand.

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.7.pli: Hotha me āyasmanto dhammato vinayato pakkhā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.2.7.eng: Please side with me, venerables, in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.8.pli: Alabhi kho so bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe.
pli-tv-kd10:1.2.8.eng: He was able to form a faction.

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.9.pli: Jānapadānampi sandiṭṭhānaṃ sambhattānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—
pli-tv-kd10:1.2.9.eng: He then sent the same message to his friends in the country,

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.14.pli: Hontu me āyasmanto dhammato vinayato pakkhā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.2.15.pli: Alabhi kho so bhikkhu jānapadepi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe.
pli-tv-kd10:1.2.15.eng: and again he was able to form a faction.

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho te ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū yena ukkhepakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā ukkhepake bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd10:1.3.1.eng: The monks who sided with him went to the monks who had ejected him and said,

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.3.pli: Anāpanno eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu āpanno.
pli-tv-kd10:1.3.3.eng: and so this monk hasn’t committed any.

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.4.pli: Anukkhitto eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu ukkhitto.

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.5.eng: for the legal procedure was illegitimate, reversible, and unfit to stand.”

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.6.pli: Evaṃ vutte, ukkhepakā bhikkhū ukkhittānuvattake bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.8.pli: Āpanno eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu anāpanno.

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.9.pli: Ukkhitto eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu anukkhitto.

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.10.eng: The legal procedure was legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.11.pli: Mā kho tumhe āyasmanto etaṃ ukkhittakaṃ bhikkhuṃ anuvattittha anuparivārethā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.3.11.eng: Venerables, don’t side with this monk.”

pli-tv-kd10:1.3.12.pli: Evampi kho te ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū ukkhepakehi bhikkhūhi vuccamānā tatheva taṃ ukkhittakaṃ bhikkhuṃ anuvattiṃsu anuparivāresuṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:1.3.12.eng: But they still sided with him.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.1.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:1.4.1.eng: Soon afterwards a certain monk went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:1.4.2.eng: and told him all that had happened.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.3.pli: “idha, bhante, aññataro bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno ahosi.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.4.pli: So tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhi ahosi, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhino ahesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.5.pli: So aparena samayena tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi ahosi, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino ahesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.6.pli: Atha kho te, bhante, bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.9.pli: Atha kho te, bhante, bhikkhū sāmaggiṃ labhitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṃsu.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.10.pli: So ca, bhante, bhikkhu bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.11.pli: Atha kho so, bhante, bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.17.pli: Hotha me āyasmanto dhammato vinayato pakkhā’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.18.pli: Alabhi kho so, bhante, bhikkhu sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.19.pli: Jānapadānampi sandiṭṭhānaṃ sambhattānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.25.pli: Hontu me āyasmanto dhammato vinayato pakkhā’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.26.pli: Alabhi kho so, bhante, bhikkhu jānapadepi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū pakkhe.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.27.pli: Atha kho te, bhante, ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū yena ukkhepakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā ukkhepake bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.30.pli: Anāpanno eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu āpanno.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.31.pli: Anukkhitto eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu ukkhitto.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.33.pli: Evaṃ vutte, te, bhante, ukkhepakā bhikkhū ukkhittānuvattake bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.36.pli: Āpanno eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu anāpanno.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.37.pli: Ukkhitto eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu anukkhitto.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.39.pli: Mā kho tumhe āyasmanto etaṃ ukkhittakaṃ bhikkhuṃ anuvattittha anuparivārethā’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.4.40.pli: Evampi kho te, bhante, ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū ukkhepakehi bhikkhūhi vuccamānā tatheva taṃ ukkhittakaṃ bhikkhuṃ anuvattanti anuparivārentī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.5.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā—“bhinno bhikkhusaṅgho, bhinno bhikkhusaṅgho”ti—
pli-tv-kd10:1.5.1.eng: Realizing that the Sangha of monks was divided, the Buddha

pli-tv-kd10:1.5.2.pli: uṭṭhāyāsanā yena ukkhepakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā ukkhepake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:1.5.2.eng: got up from his seat, went to those monks who had done the ejecting, and sat down on the prepared seat. He then said to those monks:

pli-tv-kd10:1.5.3.pli: “mā kho tumhe, bhikkhave—‘paṭibhāti no, paṭibhāti no’ti—yasmiṃ vā tasmiṃ vā bhikkhuṃ ukkhipitabbaṃ maññittha.
pli-tv-kd10:1.5.3.eng: “Don’t just eject a monk for any kind of offense merely because it seems clear to you that he’s committed it.

pli-tv-kd10:1.6.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.6.1.eng: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd10:1.6.2.pli: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.6.2.eng: He doesn’t regard it as an offense, but there are other monks who do.

pli-tv-kd10:1.6.3.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ evaṃ jānanti—‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd10:1.6.3.eng: If they know, ‘This monk is learned and a master of the tradition; he’s an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he’s knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd10:1.6.4.pli: Sace mayaṃ imaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissāma, na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ uposathaṃ karissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā uposathaṃ karissāma, bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi na so bhikkhu āpattiyā adassane ukkhipitabbo.
pli-tv-kd10:1.6.4.eng: If we eject him for not recognizing an offense, we won’t be to able do the observance-day ceremony with him. Because of this, there’ll be arguments and disputes in the Sangha; there’ll be schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha,’ and if they understand the gravity of schism, they shouldn’t eject that monk.

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.1.eng: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.2.pli: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.2.eng: He doesn’t regard it as an offense, but there are other monks who do.

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.3.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ evaṃ jānanti—‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā bahussuto āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito byatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.3.eng: If they know, ‘This monk is learned and a master of the tradition; he’s an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he’s knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.4.pli: Sace mayaṃ imaṃ bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissāma, na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ pavāressāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā pavāressāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.4.eng: If we eject him for not recognizing an offense, we won’t be able to do the invitation ceremony with him;

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.5.pli: Na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ saṅghakammaṃ karissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā saṅghakammaṃ karissāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.5.eng: we won’t be able to do legal procedures with him;

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.6.pli: Na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ āsane nisīdissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā āsane nisīdissāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.6.eng: we won’t share a seat with him;

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.7.pli: Na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ yāgupāne nisīdissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā yāgupāne nisīdissāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.7.eng: we won’t drink congee with him;

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.8.pli: Na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ bhattagge nisīdissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā bhattagge nisīdissāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.8.eng: we won’t sit in the dining hall with him;

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.9.pli: Na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne vasissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā ekacchanne vasissāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.9.eng: we won’t stay in the same room with him;

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.10.pli: Na mayaṃ iminā bhikkhunā saddhiṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ karissāma, vinā iminā bhikkhunā yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ karissāma.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.10.eng: we won’t bow down, stand up, raise our joined palms, or do acts of respect toward one another according to seniority.

pli-tv-kd10:1.7.11.pli: Bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi na so bhikkhu āpattiyā adassane ukkhipitabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.7.11.eng: Because of this, there’ll be arguments and disputes in the Sangha; there’ll be schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha,’ and if they understand the gravity of schism, they shouldn’t eject that monk.”

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ukkhepakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ bhāsitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā ukkhittānuvattake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.1.eng: The Buddha got up from his seat, went to those monks who were siding with the ejected monk, and sat down on the prepared seat. He then said to those monks:

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.2.pli: “mā kho tumhe, bhikkhave, āpattiṃ āpajjitvā ‘nāmha āpannā, nāmha āpannā’ti āpattiṃ na paṭikātabbaṃ maññittha.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.2.eng: “If you’ve committed an offense, don’t refuse to make amends for it just because you think that you haven’t committed it.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.3.eng: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.4.pli: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.4.eng: He doesn’t regard it as an offense, but there are other monks who do.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.5.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu te bhikkhū evaṃ jānāti—‘ime kho āyasmanto bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā paṇḍitā byattā medhāvino lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā, nālaṃ mamaṃ vā kāraṇā aññesaṃ vā kāraṇā chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatiṃ gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.5.eng: If he knows, ‘These monks are learned and masters of the tradition; they’re experts on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; they’re knowledgeable and competent, have a sense of conscience, and are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. They’re unlikely, because of me or anyone else, to act wrongly out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.6.pli: Sace maṃ ime bhikkhū āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissanti, na mayā saddhiṃ uposathaṃ karissanti, vinā mayā uposathaṃ karissanti, bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paresampi saddhāya āpatti desetabbā.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.6.eng: And if these monks eject me for not recognizing an offense, they won’t be able do the observance-day ceremony with me. Because of this, there’ll be arguments and disputes in the Sangha; there’ll be schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha,’ and if he understands the gravity of schism, he should confess the offense even out of confidence in the others.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.7.eng: It may be that a monk has committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.8.pli: So tassā āpattiyā anāpattidiṭṭhi hoti, aññe bhikkhū tassā āpattiyā āpattidiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.8.eng: He doesn’t regard it as an offense, but there are other monks who do.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.9.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu te bhikkhū evaṃ jānāti—‘ime kho āyasmanto bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā paṇḍitā byattā medhāvino lajjino kukkuccakā sikkhākāmā, nālaṃ mamaṃ vā kāraṇā aññesaṃ vā kāraṇā chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatiṃ gantuṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.9.eng: If he knows, ‘These monks are learned and masters of the tradition; they’re experts on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; they’re knowledgeable and competent, have a sense of conscience, and are afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training. They’re unlikely, because of me or anyone else, to act wrongly out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear.

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.10.pli: Sace maṃ ime bhikkhū āpattiyā adassane ukkhipissanti, na mayā saddhiṃ pavāressanti, vinā mayā pavāressanti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.10.eng: And if these monks eject me for not recognizing an offense, they won’t be able to do the invitation ceremony with me;

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.11.pli: Na mayā saddhiṃ saṅghakammaṃ karissanti, vinā mayā saṅghakammaṃ karissanti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.11.eng: they won’t be able to do legal procedures with me;

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.12.pli: Na mayā saddhiṃ āsane nisīdissanti, vinā mayā āsane nisīdissanti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.12.eng: they won’t share a seat with me;

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.13.pli: Na mayā saddhiṃ yāgupāne nisīdissanti, vinā mayā yāgupāne nisīdissanti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.13.eng: they won’t drink congee with me;

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.14.pli: Na mayā saddhiṃ bhattagge nisīdissanti vinā mayā bhattagge nisīdissanti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.14.eng: they won’t sit in the dining hall with me;

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.15.pli: Na mayā saddhiṃ ekacchanne vasissanti, vinā mayā ekacchanne vasissanti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.15.eng: they won’t stay in the same room with me;

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.16.pli: Na mayā saddhiṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ karissanti, vinā mayā yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ karissanti, bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇan’ti, bhedagarukena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paresampi saddhāya āpatti desetabbā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.16.eng: we won’t bow down, stand up, raise our joined palms, or do acts of respect toward one another according to seniority. Because of this, there’ll be arguments and disputes in the Sangha; there’ll be schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha,’ and if he understands the gravity of schism, he should confess the offense even out of confidence in the others.”

pli-tv-kd10:1.8.17.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ukkhittānuvattakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ bhāsitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd10:1.8.17.eng: The Buddha then got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.0.eng: Monks belonging to different Buddhist sects

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṃ karonti, saṅghakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.9.1.eng: Soon those monks who sided with the ejected monk did the observance-day ceremony and legal procedures right there within the monastery zone.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.2.pli: Ukkhepakā pana bhikkhū nissīmaṃ gantvā uposathaṃ karonti, saṅghakammaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd10:1.9.2.eng: But the monks who had ejected him went outside the monastery zone and did the observance-day ceremony and legal procedures there.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.3.pli: Atha kho aññataro ukkhepako bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:1.9.3.eng: One of the monks who had done the ejecting went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:1.9.4.eng: and told him what was happening.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.5.pli: “Te, bhante, ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṃ karonti, saṅghakammaṃ karonti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.6.pli: Mayaṃ pana ukkhepakā bhikkhū nissīmaṃ gantvā uposathaṃ karoma, saṅghakammaṃ karomā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.7.pli: “Te ce, bhikkhu, ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṃ karissanti, saṅghakammaṃ karissanti, yathā mayā ñatti ca anussāvanā ca paññattā, tesaṃ tāni kammāni dhammikāni kammāni bhavissanti akuppāni ṭhānārahāni.
pli-tv-kd10:1.9.7.eng: The Buddha replied: “If those monks who side with the ejected monk do the observance-day ceremony and legal procedures right there within the monastery zone, and it’s in accordance with the motion and announcements as I’ve laid them down, then those procedures are legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd10:1.9.8.pli: Tumhe ce, bhikkhu, ukkhepakā bhikkhū tattheva antosīmāya uposathaṃ karissatha, saṅghakammaṃ karissatha, yathā mayā ñatti ca anussāvanā ca paññattā, tumhākampi tāni kammāni dhammikāni kammāni bhavissanti akuppāni ṭhānārahāni.
pli-tv-kd10:1.9.8.eng: And if you, the monks who did the ejecting, do the observance-day ceremony and legal procedures right there within the monastery zone, and it’s in accordance with the motion and announcements as I’ve laid them down, then those procedures too are legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd10:1.10.1.pli: Nānāsaṃvāsakā ete bhikkhū tumhehi, tumhe ca tehi nānāsaṃvāsakā.
pli-tv-kd10:1.10.1.eng: This is so because you now belong to a different Buddhist sect.

pli-tv-kd10:1.10.2.eng: There are these two grounds for belonging to a different Buddhist sect.

pli-tv-kd10:1.10.3.pli: attanā vā attānaṃ nānāsaṃvāsakaṃ karoti, samaggo vā naṃ saṅgho ukkhipati adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā.
pli-tv-kd10:1.10.3.eng: Either one makes oneself belong to a different Buddhist sect, or a unanimous assembly ejects one for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd10:1.10.5.eng: And there are these two grounds for belonging to the same Buddhist sect.

pli-tv-kd10:1.10.6.pli: attanā vā attānaṃ samānasaṃvāsaṃ karoti, samaggo vā naṃ saṅgho ukkhittaṃ osāreti adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā.
pli-tv-kd10:1.10.6.eng: Either one makes oneself belong to the same Buddhist sect, or a unanimous assembly readmits one who had been ejected for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends for an offense, or for not giving up a bad view.”
pli-tv-kd10:1.10.6.comm: Nānāsaṁvāsa (and samānasaṁvāsa) need to be carefully distinguished from nānāsaṁvāsaka (and samānasaṁvāsaka). The former means “belonging to a different community”, as decided by sīmās. The latter means “one belonging to a different Buddhist sect”.

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.0.eng: Proper conduct when the Sangha is divided

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṃ ananulomikaṃ kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ upadaṃsenti, hatthaparāmāsaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.1.eng: At this time the monks were arguing and disputing in the dining halls in inhabited areas, behaving improperly by body and speech, such as grabbing one another.

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṃ ananulomikaṃ kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ upadaṃsessanti, hatthaparāmāsaṃ karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.3.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics behave like this?”

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.5.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṃ ananulomikaṃ kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ upadaṃsessanti, hatthaparāmāsaṃ karissantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhattagge antaraghare bhaṇḍanajātā …pe… hatthaparāmāsaṃ karontī”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that monks are behaving like this?”

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.11.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.11.eng: He then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.12.pli: “bhinne, bhikkhave, saṅghe adhammiyāyamāne asammodikāya vattamānāya ‘ettāvatā na aññamaññaṃ ananulomikaṃ kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ upadaṃsessāma, hatthaparāmāsaṃ karissāmā’ti—
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.12.eng: “When the Sangha is divided and the monks are behaving contrary to the Teaching and are not on friendly terms,

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.13.eng: they should sit down and reflect, ‘We won’t behave improperly by body or speech, such as grabbing one another.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.1.14.pli: Bhinne, bhikkhave, saṅghe dhammiyāyamāne sammodikāya vattamānāya āsanantarikāya nisīditabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.14.eng: When the Sangha is divided, but the monks are behaving in accordance with the Teaching and are on friendly terms, they should sit down one seat apart.”
pli-tv-kd10:2.1.14.comm: Sp 3.456: Ekekaṁ āsanaṁ antaraṁ katvā nisīditabbaṁ, “They should sit down, having made a gap between each seat.” Presumably this refers to any situation where monks from different sides are sitting next to each other.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṃ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.1.eng: The monks were also arguing and disputing in the midst of the Sangha, attacking one another verbally,

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.2.pli: Te na sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.2.eng: and were unable to resolve that legal issue.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.3.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.3.eng: A certain monk went to the Buddha, bowed, and told him what was happening, adding,

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.4.pli: “idha, bhante, bhikkhū saṅghamajjhe bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṃ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.5.pli: Te na sakkonti taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametuṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.6.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.6.eng: “Sir, please go to those monks out of compassion.”

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.7.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.8.eng: He then went to those monks, sat down on the prepared seat, and said,

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.9.pli: “alaṃ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.10.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro adhammavādī bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.10.eng: A certain monk who spoke contrary to the Teaching replied,

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.12.eng: you’re the Lord of the Teaching. Be at ease and enjoy the happiness of meditation.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.13.pli: Mayametena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.13.eng: We’ll face the consequences of this quarrelling and disputing.”

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.14.pli: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.2.14.eng: The Buddha repeated his appeal to those monks,

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.15.pli: “alaṃ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.16.pli: Dutiyampi kho so adhammavādī bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:2.2.19.pli: Mayametena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.2.pli: “bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, bārāṇasiyaṃ brahmadatto nāma kāsirājā ahosi aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo mahabbalo mahāvāhano mahāvijito paripuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.2.eng: “At one time in Benares, monks, there was a king of Kāsi called Brahmadatta. He was rich and powerful, had many vehicles and transport animals, and possessed a large kingdom and much wealth.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.3.pli: Dīghīti nāma kosalarājā ahosi daliddo appadhano appabhogo appabalo appavāhano appavijito aparipuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.3.eng: Then there was Dīghīti, the king of Kosala, who was poor and had little power, who had few vehicles and transport animals, and who possessed only a small kingdom and little wealth.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.4.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannayhitvā dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ abbhuyyāsi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.4.eng: At one time King Brahmadatta, armed with his fourfold army, marched out to attack King Dīghīti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.5.pli: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā—‘brahmadatto kira kāsirājā caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannayhitvā mamaṃ abbhuyyāto’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.5.eng: When King Dīghīti heard about this,

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.6.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño etadahosi—‘brahmadatto kho kāsirājā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo mahabbalo mahāvāhano mahāvijito paripuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro, ahaṃ panamhi daliddo appadhano appabhogo appabalo appavāhano appavijito aparipuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro, nāhaṃ paṭibalo brahmadattena kāsiraññā ekasaṅghātampi sahituṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.6.eng: he reflected on King Brahmadatta’s superior wealth and power, and he concluded, ‘I’m incapable of repelling even a single strike from Brahmadatta.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.7.eng: Let me flee the town before he arrives.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.8.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā mahesiṃ ādāya paṭikacceva nagaramhā nippati.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.8.eng: And he fled the town together with his queen.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.9.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghītissa kosalarañño balañca vāhanañca janapadañca kosañca koṭṭhāgārañca abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.9.eng: King Brahmadatta then conquered and seized King Dīghīti’s army, vehicles, and transport animals, as well as his country and wealth.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.10.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā sapajāpatiko yena bārāṇasī tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.10.eng: King Dīghīti and his wife set out for Benares.

pli-tv-kd10:2.3.11.pli: Anupubbena yena bārāṇasī tadavasari. Tatra sudaṃ, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā sapajāpatiko bārāṇasiyaṃ aññatarasmiṃ paccantime okāse kumbhakāranivesane aññātakavesena paribbājakacchannena paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd10:2.3.11.eng: When they eventually arrived, they stayed in the house of a potter on the edge of the town, disguised as wanderers.

pli-tv-kd10:2.4.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī nacirasseva gabbhinī ahosi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.4.2.pli: Tassā evarūpo dohaḷo uppanno hoti—icchati sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannaddhaṃ vammikaṃ subhūme ṭhitaṃ passituṃ, khaggānañca dhovanaṃ pātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.4.2.eng: She craved to see the fully equipped fourfold army arrayed on even ground at sunrise and to drink water from the washing of swords.

pli-tv-kd10:2.4.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ etadavoca—‘gabbhinīmhi, deva. Tassā me evarūpo dohaḷo uppanno—icchāmi sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannaddhaṃ vammikaṃ subhūme ṭhitaṃ passituṃ, khaggānañca dhovanaṃ pātun’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.4.4.pli: ‘Kuto, devi, amhākaṃ duggatānaṃ caturaṅginī senā sannaddhā vammikā subhūme ṭhitā, khaggānañca dhovanaṃ pātun’ti
pli-tv-kd10:2.4.4.eng: He said, ‘How can we possibly achieve this when things are so difficult for us?’

pli-tv-kd10:2.4.5.eng: She replied, ‘Well, if I don’t get it, I’ll die.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena, brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo dīghītissa kosalarañño sahāyo hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.5.1.eng: At that time King Brahmadatta had a brahmin counselor who was a friend of King Dīghīti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā yena brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohitaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca—‘sakhī te, samma, gabbhinī.
pli-tv-kd10:2.5.2.eng: King Dīghīti went to his friend and told him about his wife’s pregnancy

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.3.pli: Tassā evarūpo dohaḷo uppanno—icchati sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannaddhaṃ vammikaṃ subhūme ṭhitaṃ passituṃ, khaggānañca dhovanaṃ pātun’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.4.eng: The brahmin replied, ‘Well then, let me see the queen.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.5.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī yena brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd10:2.5.5.eng: The queen then went to that brahmin.

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.6.pli: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesiṃ dūratova āgacchantiṃ, disvāna uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd10:2.5.6.eng: When he saw her coming, he got up from his seat, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and uttered a heartfelt exclamation three times:

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.7.pli: ‘kosalarājā vata bho kucchigato, kosalarājā vata bho kucchigatoti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.5.7.eng: ‘You have the king of Kosala in your womb!’

pli-tv-kd10:2.5.9.pli: Lacchasi sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannaddhaṃ vammikaṃ subhūme ṭhitaṃ passituṃ, khaggānañca dhovanaṃ pātun’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.5.9.eng: You’ll get to see the fully equipped fourfold army arrayed on even ground at sunrise and to drink water from the washing of swords.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.6.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadattassa kāsirañño purohito brāhmaṇo yena brahmadatto kāsirājā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā brahmadattaṃ kāsirājānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.1.eng: The brahmin counselor then went to King Brahmadatta and said,

pli-tv-kd10:2.6.2.pli: ‘tathā, deva, nimittāni dissanti, sve sūriyuggamanakāle caturaṅginī senā sannaddhā vammikā subhūme tiṭṭhatu, khaggā ca dhoviyantū’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.2.eng: ‘The omens are such, sir, that tomorrow you should have the fully equipped fourfold army arrayed on even ground at sunrise and have the swords washed.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.6.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā manusse āṇāpesi—‘yathā, bhaṇe, purohito brāhmaṇo āha tathā karothā’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.3.eng: The king told his people to act accordingly.

pli-tv-kd10:2.6.4.pli: Alabhi kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī sūriyassa uggamanakāle caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannaddhaṃ vammikaṃ subhūme ṭhitaṃ passituṃ, khaggānañca dhovanaṃ pātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.4.eng: As a consequence, the queen was able to satisfy her craving.

pli-tv-kd10:2.6.5.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño mahesī tassa gabbhassa paripākamanvāya puttaṃ vijāyi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.5.eng: When she reached her term, the queen gave birth to a son.

pli-tv-kd10:2.6.7.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro nacirasseva viññutaṃ pāpuṇi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.7.eng: Soon enough Prince Dīghāvu became self-reliant.
pli-tv-kd10:2.6.7.comm: Viññutaṁ pāpuṇi, literally, “reached discernment”. Commenting on a similar context at Kd 20:25.1.6, Sp 4.432 explains: Yāva so dārako viññutaṁ pāpuṇātīti yāva khādituṁ bhuñjituṁ nahāyituñca maṇḍituñca attano dhammatāya sakkotīti attho, “Yāva so dārako viññutaṁ pāpuṇāti means until he is able to eat, bathe, and groom himself.”

pli-tv-kd10:2.7.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño etadahosi—‘ayaṃ kho brahmadatto kāsirājā bahuno amhākaṃ anatthassa kārako, iminā amhākaṃ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṃ, sacāyaṃ amhe jānissati, sabbeva tayo ghātāpessati, yannūnāhaṃ dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ bahinagare vāseyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.7.1.eng: King Dīghīti thought, ‘This King Brahmadatta has caused us much misfortune; he’s taken our army, our vehicles and transport animals, and our country and wealth. If he finds out about us, he’ll kill all three of us. Let me take Prince Dīghāvu to live out of town.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.7.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhavo, dīghīti kosalarājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ bahinagare vāsesi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.7.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro bahinagare paṭivasanto nacirasseva sabbasippāni sikkhi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.7.3.eng: As he was living outside of town, Prince Dīghāvu was soon training in all branches of knowledge.

pli-tv-kd10:2.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dīghītissa kosalarañño kappako brahmadatte kāsiraññe paṭivasati.
pli-tv-kd10:2.8.1.eng: At this time King Dīghīti’s old barber was living at King Brahmadatta’s court.

pli-tv-kd10:2.8.2.pli: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, dīghītissa kosalarañño kappako dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ sapajāpatikaṃ bārāṇasiyaṃ aññatarasmiṃ paccantime okāse kumbhakāranivesane aññātakavesena paribbājakacchannena paṭivasantaṃ, disvāna yena brahmadatto kāsirājā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā brahmadattaṃ kāsirājānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.8.2.eng: On one occasion he saw King Dīghīti and his wife staying in that potter’s house, disguised as wanderers. He then went to King Brahmadatta and told him.

pli-tv-kd10:2.8.3.pli: ‘dīghīti, deva, kosalarājā sapajāpatiko bārāṇasiyaṃ aññatarasmiṃ paccantime okāse kumbhakāranivesane aññātakavesena paribbājakacchannena paṭivasatī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.9.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā manusse āṇāpesi—‘tena hi, bhaṇe, dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ sapajāpatikaṃ ānethā’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.9.1.eng: The king ordered his people to get King Dīghīti and his wife.

pli-tv-kd10:2.9.2.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, te manussā brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ sapajāpatikaṃ ānesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.9.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā manusse āṇāpesi—

pli-tv-kd10:2.9.4.pli: ‘tena hi, bhaṇe, dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ sapajāpatikaṃ daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinetvā dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā dakkhiṇato nagarassa catudhā chinditvā catuddisā bilāni nikkhipathā’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.9.4.eng: ‘Bind their arms behind their backs with a strong rope and shave their heads. Parade them from street to street and square to square to the beat of a harsh drum. Then take them out of town through the southern gate, cut them in four, and place the pieces at the four directions.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.9.5.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, te manussā brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ sapajāpatikaṃ daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinenti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.9.5.eng: Saying, ‘Yes, sir,’ they bound and shaved King Dīghīti and his wife, and paraded them as instructed.

pli-tv-kd10:2.10.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—‘ciraṃdiṭṭhā kho me mātāpitaro. Yannūnāhaṃ mātāpitaro passeyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.10.1.eng: Just then Prince Dīghāvu thought, ‘I haven’t seen my parents for a long time. Why don’t I pay them a visit?’

pli-tv-kd10:2.10.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro bārāṇasiṃ pavisitvā addasa mātāpitaro daḷhāya rajjuyā pacchābāhaṃ gāḷhabandhanaṃ bandhitvā khuramuṇḍaṃ karitvā kharassarena paṇavena rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinente, disvāna yena mātāpitaro tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd10:2.10.2.eng: When he entered Benares, he saw what was happening to his parents.

pli-tv-kd10:2.10.3.pli: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ; disvāna dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.10.3.eng: As he approached them, King Dīghīti said to him,

pli-tv-kd10:2.10.4.pli: ‘mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.10.4.eng: ‘My dear Dīghāvu, see neither long nor short.

pli-tv-kd10:2.10.5.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;
pli-tv-kd10:2.10.5.eng: For hatred never ends through hatred;

pli-tv-kd10:2.10.6.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.1.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, te manussā dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ etadavocuṃ—‘ummattako ayaṃ dīghīti kosalarājā vippalapati.
pli-tv-kd10:2.11.1.eng: The people there said to King Dīghīti, ‘You’re insane, King Dīghīti, you’re babbling.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.3.pli: Kaṃ ayaṃ evamāha—mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.11.3.eng: Who are you saying this to?’

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.4.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.5.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.6.pli: ‘Nāhaṃ, bhaṇe, ummattako vippalapāmi, api ca yo viññū so vibhāvessatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.11.6.eng: ‘I’m not insane, I’m not babbling. The wise will understand.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.7.eng: King Dīghīti repeated what he had said to the prince a second

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.8.pli: tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghīti kosalarājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.11.8.eng: and a third time, and the people there reacted as before.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.9.pli: ‘mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.10.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.11.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.12.pli: Tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, te manussā dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.16.pli: “mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.17.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.18.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.19.pli: ‘Nāhaṃ, bhaṇe, ummattako vippalapāmi, api ca yo viññū so vibhāvessatī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.11.20.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, te manussā dīghītiṃ kosalarājānaṃ sapajāpatikaṃ rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ parinetvā dakkhiṇena dvārena nikkhāmetvā dakkhiṇato nagarassa catudhā chinditvā catuddisā bilāni nikkhipitvā gumbaṃ ṭhapetvā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:2.11.20.eng: Then, when the parading was finished, they took King Dīghīti and his wife through the southern gate and cut them in four. They placed the pieces at the four directions, set up guard, and departed.

pli-tv-kd10:2.12.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro bārāṇasiṃ pavisitvā suraṃ nīharitvā gumbiye pāyesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.12.1.eng: Prince Dīghāvu entered Benares, brought back some alcohol, and gave it to the guards.

pli-tv-kd10:2.12.2.pli: Yadā te mattā ahesuṃ patitā, atha kaṭṭhāni saṅkaḍḍhitvā citakaṃ karitvā mātāpitūnaṃ sarīraṃ citakaṃ āropetvā aggiṃ datvā pañjaliko tikkhattuṃ citakaṃ padakkhiṇaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.12.2.eng: When they were lying drunken on the ground, he collected sticks, built a funeral pyre, and lifted his parents’ bodies on top. He then lit the pyre, and raising his joined palms, he circumambulated it with his right side toward it.

pli-tv-kd10:2.12.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena brahmadatto kāsirājā uparipāsādavaragato hoti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.12.3.eng: Just then King Brahmadatta was up in his finest stilt house,

pli-tv-kd10:2.12.4.pli: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ pañjalikaṃ tikkhattuṃ citakaṃ padakkhiṇaṃ karontaṃ, disvānassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd10:2.12.4.eng: and he saw Prince Dīghāvu doing those funeral rites. He thought,

pli-tv-kd10:2.12.5.pli: ‘nissaṃsayaṃ kho so manusso dīghītissa kosalarañño ñāti vā sālohito vā, aho me anatthato, na hi nāma me koci ārocessatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.12.5.eng: ‘No doubt this is a relative of King Dīghīti. This is surely a sign of trouble for me, in that nobody has told me.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.13.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro araññaṃ gantvā yāvadatthaṃ kanditvā roditvā khappaṃ puñchitvā bārāṇasiṃ pavisitvā antepurassa sāmantā hatthisālaṃ gantvā hatthācariyaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.13.1.eng: The prince then went into the wilderness and cried his heart out. Wiping away his tears, he entered Benares and went to the elephant stables next to the royal compound. He said to the elephant trainer,

pli-tv-kd10:2.13.2.eng: ‘Teacher, I wish to learn your profession.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.13.3.eng: ‘Well then, young brahmin, I’ll teach you.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.13.4.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṃ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.13.4.eng: Soon the prince was getting up early in the morning, singing sweetly and playing his lute in the elephant stables.

pli-tv-kd10:2.13.5.pli: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṃ mañjunā sarena gītaṃ vīṇañca vāditaṃ, sutvāna manusse pucchi—
pli-tv-kd10:2.13.5.eng: King Brahmadatta, too, was getting up early, and he heard that music. He asked his people

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.1.pli: ‘ko, bhaṇe, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṃ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesī’ti?

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.2.pli: ‘Amukassa, deva, hatthācariyassa antevāsī māṇavako rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṃ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.14.2.eng: They replied that it was a young brahmin who was an apprentice of such-and-such an elephant trainer.

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.4.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, te manussā brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ ānesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.5.pli: ‘Tvaṃ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya hatthisālāyaṃ mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesī’ti?
pli-tv-kd10:2.14.5.eng: and the king asked him whether he was the one who had been singing and playing the lute.

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.6.eng: When the prince confirmed that it was he,

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.7.pli: ‘Tena hi tvaṃ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, gāyassu, vīṇañca vādehī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.14.7.eng: the king said, ‘Well then, sing and play right here.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.8.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā ārādhāpekkho mañjunā sarena gāyi, vīṇañca vādesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.14.8.eng: Dīghāvu consented and did his best to please the king.

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.9.eng: The king said, ‘Now then, young man, please attend on me.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.10.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paccassosi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.11.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño pubbuṭṭhāyī ahosi pacchānipātī kiṅkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.
pli-tv-kd10:2.14.11.eng: The prince then got up before the king and went to bed after him. He willingly performed any services and was pleasant in his conduct and speech.

pli-tv-kd10:2.14.12.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ nacirasseva abbhantarime vissāsikaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.14.12.eng: Soon the king put the prince in an intimate position of trust.

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.1.eng: On one occasion the king said to the prince,

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.2.pli: ‘tena hi, bhaṇe māṇavaka, rathaṃ yojehi, migavaṃ gamissāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.2.eng: ‘Listen, young man. Harness a chariot, and let’s go hunting.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.3.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā rathaṃ yojetvā brahmadattaṃ kāsirājānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.3.eng: He did as asked and told the king,

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.4.pli: ‘yutto kho te, deva, ratho, yassadāni kālaṃ maññasī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.4.eng: ‘Sir, the chariot is ready. You may leave when you’re ready.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.5.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā rathaṃ abhiruhi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.7.pli: Tathā tathā rathaṃ pesesi yathā yathā aññeneva senā agamāsi aññeneva ratho.
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.7.eng: He then drove the chariot away from the army.

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.8.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dūraṃ gantvā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.8.eng: When they had gone a long way, the king said to the prince,

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.9.pli: ‘tena hi, bhaṇe māṇavaka, rathaṃ muñcassu, kilantomhi, nipajjissāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.9.eng: ‘Listen, unharness the chariot. I’m tired. I wish to lie down.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.10.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā rathaṃ muñcitvā pathaviyaṃ pallaṅkena nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.10.eng: He did as asked and then sat down cross-legged on the ground.

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.11.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvussa kumārassa ucchaṅge sīsaṃ katvā seyyaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.15.11.eng: The king lay down, resting his head on the prince’s lap.

pli-tv-kd10:2.15.12.eng: And because he was tired, he quickly fell asleep.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.2.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho brahmadatto kāsirājā bahuno amhākaṃ anatthassa kārako.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.2.eng: ‘This king has caused us much misfortune.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.3.pli: Iminā amhākaṃ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.3.eng: He took our army, our vehicles and transport animals, and our country and wealth.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.4.eng: He killed my mother and father.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.5.pli: Ayaṃ khvassa kālo yohaṃ veraṃ appeyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṃ nibbāhi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.5.eng: This is my chance to take revenge.’ And he drew his sword from its scabbard.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.6.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.7.pli: ‘pitā kho maṃ maraṇakāle avaca “mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.7.eng: ‘At the time of his death, my father said to me, “My dear Dīghāvu, see neither long nor short.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.8.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.8.eng: For hatred never ends through hatred;

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.9.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.10.pli: Na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ, yvāhaṃ pituvacanaṃ atikkameyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṃ pavesesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.10.eng: It wouldn’t be right for me to ignore my father’s advice.’ And he returned the sword to its scabbard.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.11.pli: Dutiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.11.eng: A second and a third time he had the same thoughts, and each time he ended up returning the sword to its scabbard.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.12.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho brahmadatto kāsirājā bahuno amhākaṃ anatthassa kārako, iminā amhākaṃ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṃ, iminā ca me mātāpitaro hatā, ayaṃ khvassa kālo yohaṃ veraṃ appeyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṃ nibbāhi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.13.pli: Dutiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.14.pli: ‘pitā kho maṃ maraṇakāle avaca “mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ, na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.15.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.16.pli: Na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ, yvāhaṃ pituvacanaṃ atikkameyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.18.pli: Tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.19.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho brahmadatto kāsirājā bahuno amhākaṃ anatthassa kārako.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.20.pli: Iminā amhākaṃ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.22.pli: Ayaṃ khvassa kālo yohaṃ veraṃ appeyyan’ti kosiyā khaggaṃ nibbāhi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.23.pli: Tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvussa kumārassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.24.pli: ‘pitā kho maṃ maraṇakāle avaca “mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.25.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.26.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.27.pli: Na kho metaṃ patirūpaṃ, yvāhaṃ pituvacanaṃ atikkameyyan’ti punadeva kosiyā khaggaṃ pavesesi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.28.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā vuṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.28.eng: Just then King Brahmadatta suddenly got up, frightened and alarmed.

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.29.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattaṃ kāsirājānaṃ etadavoca—‘kissa tvaṃ, deva, bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā vuṭṭhāsī’ti?
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.29.eng: The prince asked him what was the matter,

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.30.pli: ‘Idha maṃ, bhaṇe māṇavaka, dīghītissa kosalarañño putto dīghāvu kumāro supinantena khaggena paripātesi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.16.30.eng: and the king said, ‘I just dreamed that Prince Dīghāvu, the son of Dīghīti the king of Kosala, attacked me with a sword.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.16.31.pli: Tenāhaṃ bhīto ubbiggo ussaṅkī utrasto sahasā vuṭṭhāsin’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro vāmena hatthena brahmadattassa kāsirañño sīsaṃ parāmasitvā dakkhiṇena hatthena khaggaṃ nibbāhetvā brahmadattaṃ kāsirājānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.1.eng: Seizing the king’s head with his left hand and drawing his sword with his right hand, the prince said to the king,

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.2.pli: ‘ahaṃ kho so, deva, dīghītissa kosalarañño putto dīghāvu kumāro.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.2.eng: ‘Sir, I’m that Prince Dīghāvu, the son of Dīghīti the king of Kosala.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.4.pli: Tayā amhākaṃ balañca vāhanañca janapado ca koso ca koṭṭhāgārañca acchinnaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.4.eng: You took our army, our vehicles and transport animals, and our country and wealth.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.5.eng: You killed my mother and father.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.6.pli: Ayaṃ khvassa kālo yvāhaṃ veraṃ appeyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.6.eng: This is my chance to take revenge.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.7.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvussa kumārassa pādesu sirasā nipatitvā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.7.eng: The king bowed down with his head at the prince’s feet and said,

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.8.pli: ‘jīvitaṃ me, tāta dīghāvu, dehi. Jīvitaṃ me, tāta dīghāvu, dehī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.9.eng: ‘Who am I to spare your life?

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.10.eng: Sir, it’s you who should spare mine.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.11.pli: ‘Tena hi, tāta dīghāvu, tvañceva me jīvitaṃ dehi, ahañca te jīvitaṃ dammī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.11.eng: ‘Well then, Dīghāvu, if you spare my life, I’ll spare yours.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.12.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto ca kāsirājā dīghāvu ca kumāro aññamaññassa jīvitaṃ adaṃsu, pāṇiñca aggahesuṃ, sapathañca akaṃsu addūbhāya.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.12.eng: The king and Dīghāvu spared each other’s lives. They shook hands and made a vow not to harm one another.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.13.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.13.eng: The king said to the prince,

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.14.pli: ‘tena hi, tāta dīghāvu, rathaṃ yojehi, gamissāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.14.eng: ‘Well then, Dīghāvu, harness the chariot and let’s go.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.15.pli: ‘Evaṃ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, dīghāvu kumāro brahmadattassa kāsirañño paṭissutvā rathaṃ yojetvā brahmadattaṃ kāsirājānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.15.eng: He did as asked and told to the king,

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.16.pli: ‘yutto kho te, deva, ratho, yassadāni kālaṃ maññasī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.16.eng: ‘Sir, the chariot is ready. You may leave when you’re ready.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.17.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā rathaṃ abhiruhi.

pli-tv-kd10:2.17.19.pli: Tathā tathā rathaṃ pesesi yathā yathā nacirasseva senāya samāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.17.19.eng: And he drove it so that it soon rejoined the army.

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā bārāṇasiṃ pavisitvā amacce pārisajje sannipātāpetvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.18.1.eng: When he was back in Benares, the king gathered his court and said,

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.2.pli: ‘sace, bhaṇe, dīghītissa kosalarañño puttaṃ dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ passeyyātha, kinti naṃ kareyyāthā’ti?
pli-tv-kd10:2.18.2.eng: ‘Now, let me ask you: if you saw Prince Dīghāvu, the son of Dīghīti the king of Kosala, what would you do to him?’

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.6.eng: ‘We’d cut off both his hands and feet;’

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.9.eng: ‘We’d cut off both his ears and nose;’

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.11.pli: ‘Ayaṃ kho, bhaṇe, dīghītissa kosalarañño putto dīghāvu kumāro.
pli-tv-kd10:2.18.11.eng: ‘Well, this is Prince Dīghāvu, the son of Dīghīti the king of Kosala.

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.12.eng: You shouldn’t do anything to harm him.

pli-tv-kd10:2.18.13.pli: Iminā ca me jīvitaṃ dinnaṃ, mayā ca imassa jīvitaṃ dinnan’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.18.13.eng: I’ve spared his life and he’s spared mine.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmadatto kāsirājā dīghāvuṃ kumāraṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.1.eng: Soon afterwards the king said to Dīghāvu,

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.2.pli: ‘yaṃ kho te, tāta dīghāvu, pitā maraṇakāle avaca “mā kho tvaṃ, tāta dīghāvu, dīghaṃ passa, mā rassaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.2.eng: ‘Dīghāvu, what’s the meaning of that which your father told you at the time of his death?’

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.3.pli: Na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.4.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti, kiṃ te pitā sandhāya avacā’ti?

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.5.pli: ‘Yaṃ kho me, deva, pitā maraṇakāle avaca “mā dīghan”ti mā ciraṃ veraṃ akāsīti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.5.eng: ‘When he said, “Not long,” he meant, “Don’t harbor hate for a long time.”

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.6.pli: Imaṃ kho me, deva, pitā maraṇakāle avaca “mā dīghan”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.7.pli: Yaṃ kho me, deva, pitā maraṇakāle avaca “mā rassan”ti mā khippaṃ mittehi bhijjitthāti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.7.eng: When he said, “Not short,” he meant, “Don’t hastily break with your friends.”

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.8.pli: Imaṃ kho me, deva, pitā maraṇakāle avaca “mā rassan”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.9.pli: Yaṃ kho me, deva, pitā maraṇakāle avaca “na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti, averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”ti devena me mātāpitaro hatāti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.9.eng: And when he said, “For hatred never ends through hatred; hatred only ends through love,” he was referring to your killing of my mother and father.

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.10.pli: Sacāhaṃ devaṃ jīvitā voropeyyaṃ, ye devassa atthakāmā te maṃ jīvitā voropeyyuṃ, ye me atthakāmā te te jīvitā voropeyyuṃ—
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.10.eng: For if I had killed you, those who wish you well would’ve killed me, and those who wish me well would in turn have killed them.

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.11.pli: evaṃ taṃ veraṃ verena na vūpasameyya.
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.11.eng: In this way the hatred would never end through hatred.

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.12.pli: Idāni ca pana me devena jīvitaṃ dinnaṃ, mayā ca devassa jīvitaṃ dinnaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:2.19.12.eng: But now you’ve spared my life and I’ve spared yours.

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.13.eng: In this way hatred ends through love.’

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.14.pli: Imaṃ kho me, deva, pitā maraṇakāle avaca—

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.15.pli: “na hi, tāta dīghāvu, verena verā sammanti;

pli-tv-kd10:2.19.16.pli: averena hi, tāta dīghāvu, verā sammantī”’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.3.pli: Yāva paṇḍito ayaṃ dīghāvu kumāro, yatra hi nāma pituno saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānissatī’ti pettikaṃ balañca vāhanañca janapadañca kosañca koṭṭhāgārañca paṭipādesi, dhītarañca adāsi.
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.3.eng: how wise Dīghāvu is, as he’s able to fully understand the meaning of his father’s brief statement.’ He gave him back his father’s army, his vehicles and transport animals, and his country and wealth. And he also gave him his own daughter.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.4.pli: Tesañhi nāma, bhikkhave, rājūnaṃ ādinnadaṇḍānaṃ ādinnasatthānaṃ evarūpaṃ khantisoraccaṃ bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.4.eng: “In this way, monks, those kings who had the authority to punish were actually patient and gentle.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.5.pli: Idha kho pana taṃ, bhikkhave, sobhetha yaṃ tumhe evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitā samānā khamā ca bhaveyyātha soratā cā”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.5.eng: But right here, you who’ve gone forth on this well-proclaimed spiritual path, do you shine with your patience and gentleness?”

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.6.pli: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.6.eng: A third time the Buddha said to those monks,

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.7.pli: “alaṃ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.8.pli: Tatiyampi kho so adhammavādī bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.8.eng: And a third time that monk who spoke contrary to the Teaching replied,

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.9.eng: “Wait, sir, you’re the Lord of the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.10.eng: Be at ease and enjoy the happiness of meditation.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.11.pli: Mayametena bhaṇḍanena kalahena viggahena vivādena paññāyissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.11.eng: We’ll face the consequences of this quarreling and disputing.”

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.13.pli: “pariyādinnarūpā kho ime moghapurisā, nayime sukarā saññāpetun”ti—
pli-tv-kd10:2.20.13.eng: “These foolish men are consumed by emotions. It’s not easy to persuade them,”

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.14.eng: and he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-kd10:2.20.15.eng: The first section for recitation on Dīghāvu is finished.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kosambiṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd10:3.1.1.eng: Then, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and entered Kosambī for alms.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.2.pli: Kosambiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya saṅghamajjhe ṭhitakova imā gāthāyo abhāsi—
pli-tv-kd10:3.1.2.eng: When he had completed his almsround, eaten his meal, and returned, he put his dwelling in order. He then took his bowl and robe, and while standing in the midst of the Sangha, he spoke these verses:

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.4.eng: No-one thinks they are a fool.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.6.eng: They do not think it through.
pli-tv-kd10:3.1.6.comm: Literally, “They do not think there is something more.” Sp 3.464: Nāññaṁ bhiyyo amaññarunti koci ekopi “ahaṁ bālo”ti ca na maññittha; bhiyyo ca saṅghasmiṁ bhijjamāne aññampi ekaṁ “mayhaṁ kāraṇā saṅgho bhijjatī”ti idaṁ kāraṇaṁ na maññitthāti attho, “The meaning of nāññaṁ bhiyyo amaññarun is: not even one thinks, ‘I am a fool.’ And more, when the Sangha is being split, not even one other thinks of this action that, ‘The Sangha is being split because of me.’”

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.10.eng: They don’t know what leads them on.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.12.eng: They defeated me, they robbed me.’

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.13.eng: For those who carry on like this,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.16.eng: They defeated me, they robbed me.’

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.17.eng: For those who do not carry on like this,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.21.eng: Only through love does it end—

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.25.eng: But there are those there who know,
pli-tv-kd10:3.1.25.comm: Sp 3.464: Ye ca tattha vijānantīti ye tattha paṇḍitā “mayaṁ maccusamīpaṁ gacchāmā”ti vijānanti, “Ye ca tattha vijānanti: those there who are wise, they understand: ‘We are going close to death.’”

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.26.comm: Sp 3.464: Tato sammanti medhagāti evañhi te jānantā yonisomanasikāraṁ uppādetvā medhagānaṁ kalahānaṁ vūpasamāya paṭipajjanti, “Tato sammanti medhagā: for they know this by giving rise to wise attention. They practice for the ending of quarrel and strife.”

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.28.eng: Those taking cows, horses, and wealth,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.32.eng: If you find a discerning friend,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.33.eng: A steadfast companion, good to live with,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.35.eng: And go with them, glad and mindful.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.36.eng: If you do not find a discerning friend,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.37.eng: A steadfast companion, good to live with,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.38.eng: Then like a king giving up his kingdom,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.39.eng: Wander alone like a mighty elephant in the forest.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.41.eng: For there is no friendship with fools.

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.42.pli: Eko care na ca pāpāni kayirā,
pli-tv-kd10:3.1.42.eng: Wander alone and do no bad,

pli-tv-kd10:3.1.43.eng: Unconcerned, like a mighty elephant in the forest.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.0.eng: 3. The account of going to Bālakaloṇaka

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā saṅghamajjhe ṭhitakova imā gāthāyo bhāsitvā yena bālakaloṇakagāmo tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.1.eng: After speaking these verses, the Buddha went to the village of Bālakaloṇaka.

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā bhagu bālakaloṇakagāme viharati.
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Bhagu was staying near that village.

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.3.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā bhagu bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ, disvāna āsanaṃ paññapesi, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipi, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.3.eng: When Bhagu saw the Buddha coming, he prepared a seat and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He then went out to meet the Buddha, receiving his bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.4.pli: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane, nisajja kho bhagavā pāde pakkhālesi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.4.eng: The Buddha sat down on the prepared seat and washed his feet.

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.5.pli: Āyasmāpi kho bhagu bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.5.eng: When Bhagu had bowed and sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ bhaguṃ bhagavā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.8.pli: kacci yāpanīyaṃ, kacci piṇḍakena na kilamasī”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.8.eng: I hope you’re getting by? I hope you’re not having any trouble getting almsfood?”

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.9.eng: “I’m keeping well, sir, I’m getting by.

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.10.eng: I’m having no trouble getting almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.1.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ bhaguṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena pācīnavaṃsadāyo tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-kd10:4.1.11.eng: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened Bhagu with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and went to the Eastern Bamboo Park.

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.0.eng: 4. The account of going to the Eastern Bamboo Park

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo pācīnavaṃsadāye viharanti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.2.1.eng: At this time Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Nandiya, and Venerable Kimila were staying at the Eastern Bamboo Park.

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.2.pli: Addasā kho dāyapālo bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ, disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:4.2.2.eng: The park keeper saw the Buddha coming and said to him,

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.4.eng: There are three gentlemen here, practicing for their own good.

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.6.pli: Assosi kho āyasmā anuruddho dāyapālassa bhagavatā saddhiṃ mantayamānassa, sutvāna dāyapālaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:4.2.6.eng: When Anuruddha heard the park keeper advising the Buddha, he said,

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho yenāyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantañca nandiyaṃ āyasmantañca kimilaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:4.2.9.eng: Anuruddha then went to Nandiya and Kimila and said,

pli-tv-kd10:4.2.10.eng: “Come out, venerables, our teacher has arrived.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca nandiyo āyasmā ca kimilo bhagavantaṃ paccuggantvā eko bhagavato pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi, eko āsanaṃ paññapesi, eko pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.3.1.eng: The three of them went out to meet the Buddha. One received his bowl and robe, one prepared a seat, and one put out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet.

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.2.pli: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane, nisajja kho bhagavā pāde pakkhālesi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.3.2.eng: The Buddha sat down on the prepared seat and washed his feet.

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.3.pli: Tepi kho āyasmanto bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:4.3.3.eng: When they had bowed and sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ bhagavā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.5.eng: “I hope you’re all keeping well, Anuruddha, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.6.eng: I hope you’re not having any trouble getting almsfood?”

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.7.eng: “We’re keeping well, sir, we’re getting by.

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.8.pli: na ca mayaṃ, bhante, piṇḍakena kilamāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.3.8.eng: We’re not having any trouble getting almsfood.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.9.pli: “Kacci pana vo, anuruddhā, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṃ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:4.3.9.eng: “I hope you’re living together in peace and harmony, blending like milk and water, and regarding one another with affection?”

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.10.pli: “Taggha mayaṃ, bhante, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṃ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.3.11.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tumhe, anuruddhā, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṃ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharathā”ti?

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.2.pli: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me, yohaṃ evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṃ viharāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.4.2.eng: ‘How fortunate I am to be living with such fellow monastics!’

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.3.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, imesu āyasmantesu mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ āvi ceva raho ca;
pli-tv-kd10:4.4.3.eng: And I do acts of good will toward them by body,

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.5.pli: mettaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ āvi ceva raho ca.
pli-tv-kd10:4.4.5.eng: and mind, both in public and in private.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.7.pli: ‘yannūnāhaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ nikkhipitvā imesaṃyeva āyasmantānaṃ cittassa vasena vatteyyan’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.4.7.eng: ‘Why don’t I set aside what I wish to do and instead do what these venerables wish?’

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.8.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhante, sakaṃ cittaṃ nikkhipitvā imesaṃyeva āyasmantānaṃ cittassa vasena vattāmi.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.9.pli: Nānā hi kho no, bhante, kāyā, ekañca pana maññe cittan”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.4.9.eng: We’re separate in body, but it might seem as if we’re one in mind.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.10.eng: Nandiya and Kimila then repeated what Anuruddha had said.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.13.pli: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me, yohaṃ evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṃ viharāmī’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.14.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, imesu āyasmantesu mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ āvi ceva raho ca;

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.15.pli: mettaṃ vacīkammaṃ mettaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ āvi ceva raho ca.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.17.pli: ‘yannūnāhaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ nikkhipitvā imesaṃyeva āyasmantānaṃ cittassa vasena vatteyyan’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.18.pli: So kho ahaṃ, bhante, sakaṃ cittaṃ nikkhipitvā imesaṃyeva āyasmantānaṃ cittassa vasena vattāmi.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.19.pli: Nānā hi kho no, bhante, kāyā, ekañca pana maññe cittanti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.4.20.pli: Evaṃ kho mayaṃ, bhante, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṃ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.1.pli: “Kacci pana vo, anuruddhā, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.1.eng: “I hope, Anuruddha, that you’re heedful and energetic?”

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.2.pli: “Taggha mayaṃ, bhante, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.3.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tumhe, anuruddhā, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharathā”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.3.eng: “And how is it that you’re heedful and energetic?”

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.4.pli: “Idha, bhante, amhākaṃ yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati so āsanaṃ paññapeti, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipati, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.4.eng: “Whoever returns first from almsround in the village, he prepares the seats and sets out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He washes the bowl for leftovers and puts it back out, and sets out water for drinking and water for washing.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.5.pli: Yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, sace hoti bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkhati bhuñjati, no ce ākaṅkhati appaharite vā chaḍḍeti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.5.eng: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat the leftovers, or he discards them where there are no cultivated plants
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.5.comm: Harita could in principle refer to all plants, but it is elsewhere defined as what is cultivated, see Bu Pc 19:2.1.14 and Bi Pc 9:2.1.14.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.7.pli: So āsanaṃ uddharati, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmeti, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā paṭisāmeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmeti, bhattaggaṃ sammajjati.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.7.eng: He puts away the seats and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He washes the bowl for leftovers and puts it away, puts away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweeps the dining hall.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.7.comm: “Dining hall” renders bhattagga, literally, “an eating house”. The name suggests that the bhattagga was a separate building for eating. They were found both in private houses and in monasteries, as can be seen from the present passage. Since they were part of houses, “refectory” is not a satisfactory rendering. The fact that kitchens are not mentioned separately may mean that they were part of the bhattagga, except in monasteries. This is supported by a passage at Bu Pj 3:5.3.1 that mentions a cooking implement, a pestle, being stored in a bhattagga.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.8.pli: Yo passati pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ so upaṭṭhāpeti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.8.eng: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty fills it.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.9.pli: Sacassa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpema, na tveva mayaṃ, bhante, tappaccayā vācaṃ bhindāma.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.9.eng: If he can’t do it by himself, he calls someone over by hand signal, and they move it together. We don’t speak because of that.

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.10.pli: Pañcāhikaṃ kho pana mayaṃ, bhante, sabbarattiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sannisīdāma.
pli-tv-kd10:4.5.10.eng: And every five days we sit together the whole night to discuss the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.5.11.pli: Evaṃ kho mayaṃ, bhante, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharāmā”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.0.eng: 5. The account of going to Pālileyyaka

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantañca anuruddhaṃ āyasmantañca nandiyaṃ āyasmantañca kimilaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena pālileyyakaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.6.1.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Nandiya, and Venerable Kimila with a teaching. He then got up from his seat and set out wandering toward Pālileyyaka.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena pālileyyakaṃ tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā pālileyyake viharati rakkhitavanasaṇḍe bhaddasālamūle.
pli-tv-kd10:4.6.3.eng: he stayed in a protected forest grove, at the foot of an auspicious sal tree.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavato rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd10:4.6.4.eng: Then, while he was reflecting in private, the Buddha thought,

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.5.pli: “ahaṃ kho pubbe ākiṇṇo na phāsu vihāsiṃ tehi kosambakehi bhikkhūhi bhaṇḍanakārakehi kalahakārakehi vivādakārakehi bhassakārakehi saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakehi.
pli-tv-kd10:4.6.5.eng: “Previously, when I was surrounded by those quarreling monks at Kosambī, I wasn’t at ease.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.6.pli: Somhi etarahi eko adutiyo sukhaṃ phāsu viharāmi aññatreva tehi kosambakehi bhikkhūhi bhaṇḍanakārakehi kalahakārakehi vivādakārakehi bhassakārakehi saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.6.6.eng: But now that I’m alone, away from those monks, I’m happy and at ease.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.7.pli: Aññataropi kho hatthināgo ākiṇṇo viharati hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthikaḷabhehi hatthicchāpehi, chinnaggāni ceva tiṇāni khādati, obhaggobhaggañcassa sākhābhaṅgaṃ khādanti, āvilāni ca pānīyāni pivati, ogāhā cassa otiṇṇassa hatthiniyo kāyaṃ upanighaṃsantiyo gacchanti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.6.7.eng: At that time there was a large bull elephant who lived surrounded by a herd—by males and females, by juveniles and babies. He ate grass with the tips broken off and drank muddy water. Other elephants ate the branches that he had pulled down. And when he was immersed in a pool, the female elephants came rubbing their bodies against his.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.9.pli: “ahaṃ kho ākiṇṇo viharāmi hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthikaḷabhehi hatthicchāpehi, chinnaggāni ceva tiṇāni khādāmi, obhaggobhaggañca me sākhābhaṅgaṃ khādanti, āvilāni ca pānīyāni pivāmi, ogāhā ca me otiṇṇassa hatthiniyo kāyaṃ upanighaṃsantiyo gacchanti.

pli-tv-kd10:4.6.10.eng: “Why don’t I leave the herd and stay by myself?”

pli-tv-kd10:4.7.1.pli: Atha kho so hatthināgo yūthā apakkamma yena pālileyyakaṃ rakkhitavanasaṇḍo bhaddasālamūlaṃ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā soṇḍāya bhagavato pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, appaharitañca karoti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.7.1.eng: He then left the herd and went to Pālileyyaka, to where the Buddha was at the foot of the auspicious sal tree. And he attended on the Buddha, using his trunk to set out water for drinking and water for washing, and to clear the vegetation.

pli-tv-kd10:4.7.3.pli: “ahaṃ kho pubbe ākiṇṇo na phāsu vihāsiṃ hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthikaḷabhehi hatthicchāpehi, chinnaggāni ceva tiṇāni khādiṃ, obhaggobhaggañca me sākhābhaṅgaṃ khādiṃsu, āvilāni ca pānīyāni apāyiṃ ogāhā ca me otiṇṇassa hatthiniyo kāyaṃ upanighaṃsantiyo agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:4.7.3.eng: “Previously, when I was surrounded by the other elephants, I wasn’t at ease.

pli-tv-kd10:4.7.4.pli: Somhi etarahi eko adutiyo sukhaṃ phāsu viharāmi aññatreva hatthīhi hatthinīhi hatthikaḷabhehi hatthicchāpehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:4.7.4.eng: But now that I’m alone, away from those elephants, I’m happy and at ease.”

pli-tv-kd10:4.7.5.pli: Atha kho bhagavā attano ca pavivekaṃ viditvā tassa ca hatthināgassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd10:4.7.5.eng: After considering his own seclusion and reading the mind of the elephant, the Buddha uttered a heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd10:4.7.8.eng: Agrees with the mind of the Sage,

pli-tv-kd10:4.7.9.eng: Since they each delight in the forest solitude.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pālileyyake yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Pālileyyaka for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd10:5.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.4.eng: Soon the lay followers in Kosambī considered,

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.5.pli: “ime kho ayyā kosambakā bhikkhū bahuno amhākaṃ anatthassa kārakā.
pli-tv-kd10:5.1.5.eng: “These venerable monks at Kosambī have caused us much misfortune.

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.6.eng: The Buddha himself left because he was troubled by them.

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.7.pli: Handa mayaṃ ayye kosambake bhikkhū neva abhivādeyyāma, na paccuṭṭheyyāma, na añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ kareyyāma, na sakkareyyāma, na garuṃ kareyyāma, na māneyyāma, na bhajeyyāma, na pūjeyyāma, upagatānampi piṇḍakaṃ na dajjeyyāma—
pli-tv-kd10:5.1.7.eng: Well then, let’s not bow down, rise up, raise our joined palms, or do acts of respect toward them. And let’s not honor, respect, esteem, or associate with them, nor give them almsfood.

pli-tv-kd10:5.1.8.pli: evaṃ ime amhehi asakkariyamānā agarukariyamānā amāniyamānā abhajiyamānā apūjiyamānā asakkārapakatā pakkamissanti vā vibbhamissanti vā bhagavantaṃ vā pasādessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.1.8.eng: Then, they’ll either leave, disrobe, or reconcile with the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.2.1.pli: Atha kho kosambakā upāsakā kosambake bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na bhajesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ, upagatānampi piṇḍakaṃ na adaṃsu.

pli-tv-kd10:5.2.2.pli: Atha kho kosambakā bhikkhū kosambakehi upāsakehi asakkariyamānā agarukariyamānā amāniyamānā abhajiyamānā apūjiyamānā asakkārapakatā evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-kd10:5.2.2.eng: Soon the monks at Kosambī said,

pli-tv-kd10:5.2.3.pli: “handa mayaṃ, āvuso, sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhagavato santike imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasameyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.2.3.eng: “Well then, let’s go to Sāvatthī and resolve this legal issue in the presence of the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.2.4.0.eng: 6. The account of the eighteen grounds

pli-tv-kd10:5.2.4.1.pli: Atha kho kosambakā bhikkhū senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sāvatthi tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:5.2.4.1.eng: The monks at Kosambī put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and went to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.2.pli: “te kira kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.3.3.eng: he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.5.pli: “te kira, bhante, kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchanti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.6.eng: adding, “Sir, how should I act toward these monks?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.7.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, sāriputta, yathā dhammo tathā tiṭṭhāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.3.7.eng: “Take your stand in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.3.8.pli: “Kathāhaṃ, bhante, jāneyyaṃ dhammaṃ vā adhammaṃ vā”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:5.3.8.eng: “And how do I know what accords with the Teaching and what doesn’t?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.1.eng: “There are eighteen grounds for knowing that someone is speaking contrary to the Teaching:

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.2.pli: Idha, sāriputta, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti,
