pli-tv-kd10:5.4.2.eng: A monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it,
pli-tv-kd10:5.4.2.comm: Sp 4.351: Adhammaṁ dhammoti dīpentītiādīsu aṭṭhārasasu bhedakaravatthūsu suttantapariyāyena tāva dasa kusalakammapathā dhammo, dasa akusalakammapathā adhammo. Tathā cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, pañcindriyāni, pañca balāni, satta bojjhaṅgā, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggoti sattatiṁsa bodhipakkhiyadhammā dhammo nāma; tayo satipaṭṭhānā, tayo sammappadhānā, tayo iddhipādā, cha indriyāni, cha balāni, aṭṭha bojjhaṅgā, navaṅgiko maggoti ca cattāro upādānā, pañca nīvaraṇā, satta anusayā, aṭṭha micchattāti ca ayaṁ adhammo, “In regard to the meaning of ‘they proclaim what’s contrary to the Teaching as being in accordance with it,’ etc., according to the exposition in the discourses of the eighteen grounds for schism, the ten wholesome ways of action are in accordance with the Teaching, while the ten unwholesome ways of action are contrary to the Teaching. In the same way, the thirty-seven aids to awakening—the four focuses of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases for spiritual power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path—are in accordance with the Teaching; while the three focuses of mindfulness, the three right efforts, the three bases for spiritual power, the six faculties, the six powers, the eight factors of awakening, the noble ninefold path, as well as the four graspings, the five hindrances, the seven underlying tendencies, and the eight kinds of wrongness are all contrary to the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.3.eng: and what’s in accordance with the Teaching as contrary to it.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.4.eng: He proclaims what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as being in accordance with it,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.5.eng: and what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as contrary to it.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.6.pli: abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti,
pli-tv-kd10:5.4.6.eng: He proclaims what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by him,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.7.pli: bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;
pli-tv-kd10:5.4.7.eng: and what’s been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by him.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.8.eng: He proclaims what wasn’t practiced by the Buddha as practiced by him,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.9.eng: and what was practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by him.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.10.eng: He proclaims what wasn’t laid down by the Buddha as laid down by him,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.11.eng: and what was laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by him.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.12.eng: He proclaims a non-offense as an offense,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.13.eng: and an offense as a non-offense.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.14.eng: He proclaims a light offense as heavy,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.15.eng: and a heavy offense as light.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.16.eng: He proclaims a curable offense as incurable,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.17.eng: and an incurable offense as curable.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.18.eng: He proclaims a grave offense as minor,

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.19.eng: and a minor offense as grave.

pli-tv-kd10:5.4.20.pli: imehi kho, sāriputta, aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi adhammavādī jānitabbo.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.1.pli: Aṭṭhārasahi ca kho, sāriputta, vatthūhi dhammavādī jānitabbo.
pli-tv-kd10:5.5.1.eng: And there are eighteen grounds for knowing that someone is speaking in accordance with the Teaching:

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.2.pli: Idha, sāriputta, bhikkhu adhammaṃ adhammoti dīpeti,
pli-tv-kd10:5.5.2.eng: A monk proclaims what’s contrary to the Teaching as such,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.3.eng: and what’s in accordance with the Teaching as such.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.4.eng: He proclaims what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as such,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.5.eng: and what’s in accordance with the Monastic Law as such.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.6.pli: abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti,
pli-tv-kd10:5.5.6.eng: He proclaims what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as such,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.7.pli: bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;
pli-tv-kd10:5.5.7.eng: and what’s been spoken by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.8.eng: He proclaims what wasn’t practiced by the Buddha as such,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.9.eng: and what was practiced by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.10.eng: He proclaims what wasn’t laid down by the Buddha as such,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.11.eng: and what was laid down by the Buddha as such.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.12.eng: He proclaims a non-offense as such,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.14.eng: He proclaims a light offense as light,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.15.eng: and a heavy offense as heavy.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.16.eng: He proclaims a curable offense as curable,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.17.eng: and an incurable offense as incurable.

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.18.eng: He proclaims a grave offense as grave,

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.19.eng: and a minor offense as minor.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.5.20.pli: imehi kho, sāriputta, aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi dhammavādī jānitabbo”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.12.pli: “te kira kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā rāhulo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.6.13.eng: he too went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.14.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā rāhulo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.15.pli: “te kira, bhante, kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchanti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.16.eng: adding, “Sir, how should I act toward these monks?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.17.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, rāhula, yathā dhammo tathā tiṭṭhāhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.6.17.eng: “Take your stand in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.18.pli: “Kathāhaṃ, bhante, jāneyyaṃ dhammaṃ vā adhammaṃ vā”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:5.6.18.eng: “And how do I know what accords with the Teaching and what doesn’t?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.19.eng: The Buddha told him, too, about the eighteen grounds for knowing that someone is speaking contrary to the Teaching

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.20.pli: Idha, rāhula, bhikkhu adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti, dhammaṃ adhammoti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.21.pli: avinayaṃ vinayoti dīpeti, vinayaṃ avinayoti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.22.pli: abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.23.pli: anāciṇṇaṃ tathāgatena āciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, āciṇṇaṃ tathāgatena anāciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.24.pli: apaññattaṃ tathāgatena paññattaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, paññattaṃ tathāgatena apaññattaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.25.pli: anāpattiṃ āpattīti dīpeti, āpattiṃ anāpattīti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.26.pli: lahukaṃ āpattiṃ garukā āpattīti dīpeti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ lahukā āpattīti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.27.pli: sāvasesaṃ āpattiṃ anavasesā āpattīti dīpeti, anavasesaṃ āpattiṃ sāvasesā āpattīti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.28.pli: duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ aduṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpeti, aduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ duṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpeti—

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.29.pli: imehi kho, rāhula, aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi adhammavādī jānitabbo.

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.30.pli: Aṭṭhārasahi ca kho, rāhula, vatthūhi dhammavādī jānitabbo.
pli-tv-kd10:5.6.30.eng: and the eighteen grounds for knowing that someone is speaking in accordance with the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.31.pli: Idha, rāhula, bhikkhu adhammaṃ adhammoti dīpeti, dhammaṃ dhammoti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.32.pli: avinayaṃ avinayoti dīpeti, vinayaṃ vinayoti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.33.pli: abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.34.pli: anāciṇṇaṃ tathāgatena anāciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, āciṇṇaṃ tathāgatena āciṇṇaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.35.pli: apaññattaṃ tathāgatena apaññattaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, paññattaṃ tathāgatena paññattaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.36.pli: anāpattiṃ anāpattīti dīpeti, āpattiṃ āpattīti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.37.pli: lahukaṃ āpattiṃ lahukā āpattīti dīpeti, garukaṃ āpattiṃ garukā āpattīti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.38.pli: sāvasesaṃ āpattiṃ sāvasesā āpattīti dīpeti, anavasesaṃ āpattiṃ anavasesā āpattīti dīpeti;

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.39.pli: duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ duṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpeti, aduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ aduṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpeti—

pli-tv-kd10:5.6.40.pli: imehi kho, rāhula, aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi dhammavādī jānitabbo”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.2.pli: “te kira kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.3.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpati gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.7.3.eng: she too went to the Buddha, bowed,

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpati gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.5.pli: “te kira, bhante, kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchanti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.6.eng: adding, “Sir, how should I act toward these monks?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.7.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, gotami, ubhayattha dhammaṃ suṇa.
pli-tv-kd10:5.7.7.eng: “Well, Gotamī, listen to the teaching from both sides.

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.8.pli: Ubhayattha dhammaṃ sutvā ye tattha bhikkhū dhammavādino tesaṃ diṭṭhiñca khantiñca ruciñca ādāyañca rocehi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.7.8.eng: Then approve of the views, beliefs, and persuasion of those who speak in accordance with the Teaching.

pli-tv-kd10:5.7.9.pli: Yañca kiñci bhikkhunisaṅghena bhikkhusaṅghato paccāsīsitabbaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ dhammavāditova paccāsīsitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.7.9.eng: And whatever support the Sangha of nuns seeks from the Sangha of monks, they should get it all from those who speak in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.2.pli: “te kira kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.3.eng: he too went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.5.pli: “te kira, bhante, kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchanti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.6.eng: adding, “Sir, how should I act toward these monks?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.7.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, gahapati, ubhayattha dānaṃ dehi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.8.7.eng: “Well, householder, make offerings to both sides

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.8.pli: Ubhayattha dānaṃ datvā ubhayattha dhammaṃ suṇa.

pli-tv-kd10:5.8.9.pli: Ubhayattha dhammaṃ sutvā ye tattha bhikkhū dhammavādino tesaṃ diṭṭhiñca khantiñca ruciñca ādāyañca rocehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.8.9.eng: Then approve of the views, beliefs, and persuasion of those who speak in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.2.pli: “te kira kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.3.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.9.3.eng: she too went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.5.pli: “te kira, bhante, kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ āgacchanti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.6.eng: adding, “Sir, how should I act toward these monks?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.7.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, visākhe, ubhayattha dānaṃ dehi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.9.7.eng: “Well, Visākhā, make offerings to both sides

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.8.pli: Ubhayattha dānaṃ datvā ubhayattha dhammaṃ suṇa.

pli-tv-kd10:5.9.9.pli: Ubhayattha dhammaṃ sutvā ye tattha bhikkhū dhammavādino tesaṃ diṭṭhiñca khantiñca ruciñca ādāyañca rocehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.9.9.eng: Then approve of the views, beliefs, and persuasion of those who speak in accordance with the Teaching.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.1.pli: Atha kho kosambakā bhikkhū anupubbena yena sāvatthi tadavasaruṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:5.10.1.eng: Eventually those monks from Kosambī arrived at Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.10.2.eng: Venerable Sāriputta went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.4.pli: “te kira, bhante, kosambakā bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā sāvatthiṃ anuppattā.

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.5.pli: Kathaṃ nu kho, bhante, tesu bhikkhūsu senāsane paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:5.10.5.eng: adding, “How should we prepare dwellings for these monks?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.6.eng: “Give them dwellings in a separate place.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.7.pli: “Sace pana, bhante, vivittaṃ na hoti, kathaṃ paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:5.10.7.eng: “But what should we do if there are no dwellings in a separate place?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.8.eng: “In that case, create separate resting places and then give them out.

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.9.pli: na tvevāhaṃ, sāriputta, kenaci pariyāyena vuḍḍhatarassa bhikkhuno senāsanaṃ paṭibāhitabbanti vadāmi.
pli-tv-kd10:5.10.9.eng: Under no circumstances, Sāriputta, should a dwelling be reserved for a more senior monk.
pli-tv-kd10:5.10.9.comm: The point seems to be that if the incoming monks, at least one of whom now belong to a different Buddhist sect, are to stay in the same place as the other monks, then they must be given dwellings according to seniority. If, however, they are staying in a separate location, then seniority only counts within that location. Vmv 3.473: Vivittaṁ katvāpi dātabbanti vuttattā pana yathāvuḍḍhaṁ varasenāsanaṁ adatvā vuḍḍhānampi asaññatānaṁ saññatehi vivittaṁ katvā dātabbanti daṭṭhabbaṁ, “Because of what has been said, ‘Create separate resting places and then give them out’ is to be understood like this: not having given the best dwellings according to seniority, (the dwellings) are to be given out after separating the unrestrained senior monastics from the restrained ones.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.11.eng: “And what should we do regarding food and requisites?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.10.12.eng: “Food and requisites should be distributed equally to everyone.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.11.1.pli: Atha kho tassa ukkhittakassa bhikkhuno dhammañca vinayañca paccavekkhantassa etadahosi—
pli-tv-kd10:5.11.1.eng: Then that ejected monk reflected on the Teaching and the Monastic Law, and he concluded,

pli-tv-kd10:5.11.5.eng: for the legal procedure was legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.11.6.pli: Atha kho so ukkhittako bhikkhu yena ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ukkhittānuvattake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd10:5.11.6.eng: He went to those who were siding with him and told them

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.1.pli: Atha kho te ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū taṃ ukkhittakaṃ bhikkhuṃ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:5.12.1.eng: They then took that monk to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.10.eng: adding, “Sir, what should we do now?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.13.pli: Āpanno eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu anāpanno.
pli-tv-kd10:5.12.13.eng: and this monk has committed it.

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.14.pli: Ukkhitto eso bhikkhu, neso bhikkhu anukkhitto.

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.15.eng: for the legal procedure was legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand.

pli-tv-kd10:5.12.16.pli: Yato ca kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpanno ca ukkhitto ca passati ca, tena hi, bhikkhave, taṃ bhikkhuṃ osārethā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.12.16.eng: But since he recognizes this, he should be readmitted.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.0.eng: 8. Discussion of unity in the Sangha

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.1.pli: Atha kho te ukkhittānuvattakā bhikkhū taṃ ukkhittakaṃ bhikkhuṃ osāretvā yena ukkhepakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā ukkhepake bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-kd10:5.13.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks who had been siding with the ejected monk readmitted him. They then went to the monks who had ejected him and said,

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.2.pli: “yasmiṃ, āvuso, vatthusmiṃ ahosi saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, so eso bhikkhu āpanno ca ukkhitto ca passi ca osārito ca.
pli-tv-kd10:5.13.2.eng: “This monk has recognized that he had committed an offense and was ejected. He’s now been readmitted. Because of this, the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, has been removed.
pli-tv-kd10:5.13.2.comm: A literal translation of the Pali might read as follows: “In regard to which reason there was quarrel, argument, conflict, dispute, schism, fracture, division, and separation in the Sangha, this monk has committed, and has been ejected, and he has seen, and he has been reinstated.” I understand this to mean that the basis for the conflict has been dealt with.

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.3.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggiṃ karomā”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.13.3.eng: To resolve this matter, let’s unify the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.4.pli: Atha kho te ukkhepakā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd10:5.13.4.eng: The monks who had done the ejecting went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.7.pli: ‘yasmiṃ, āvuso, vatthusmiṃ ahosi saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, so eso bhikkhu āpanno ca ukkhitto ca passi ca osārito ca.

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.8.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggiṃ karomā’ti.

pli-tv-kd10:5.13.9.eng: adding, “How should we proceed with this?”

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.1.pli: “Yato ca kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āpanno ca ukkhitto ca passi ca osārito ca, tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggiṃ karotu.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.1.eng: “This being the case, you should resolve this matter by unifying the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.2.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.3.pli: Sabbeheva ekajjhaṃ sannipatitabbaṃ gilānehi ca agilānehi ca.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.3.eng: Everyone should gather in one place, including those who are sick.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.5.pli: Sannipatitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.5.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.6.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.7.pli: Yasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ ahosi saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, so eso bhikkhu āpanno ca ukkhitto ca passi ca osārito ca.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.7.eng: This monk has recognized that he had committed an offense and was ejected. He’s now been readmitted. Because of this, the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, has been removed.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.8.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggiṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.8.eng: If the Sangha is ready, let’s resolve this matter by unifying the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.10.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.11.pli: Yasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ ahosi saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, so eso bhikkhu āpanno ca ukkhitto ca passi ca osārito ca.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.11.eng: This monk has recognized that he had committed an offense and was ejected. He’s now been readmitted. Because of this, the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, has been removed.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.12.pli: Saṅgho tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.12.eng: The Sangha resolves this matter by unifying the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.13.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggiyā karaṇaṃ, so tuṇhassa, yassa nakkhamati so bhāseyya.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.13.eng: Any monk who approves of resolving this matter by unifying Sangha should remain silent. Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.14.pli: Katā saṅghena tassa vatthussa vūpasamāya saṅghasāmaggī.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.14.eng: The Sangha has resolved this matter by unifying the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.15.pli: Nihato saṅghabhedo, nihatā saṅgharāji, nihataṃ saṅghavavatthānaṃ, nihataṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.15.eng: The schism in the Sangha has come to an end. The fracture in the Sangha has come to an end. The separation in the Sangha has come to an end.

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.16.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd10:5.14.16.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd10:5.14.17.eng: The observance-day ceremony, the recitation of the Monastic Code, should be done straightaway.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.0.eng: 9. Upāli’s questions about unity in the Sangha

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upāli yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd10:6.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā upāli bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.3.pli: “yasmiṃ, bhante, vatthusmiṃ hoti saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, saṅgho taṃ vatthuṃ avinicchinitvā amūlā mūlaṃ gantvā saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti, dhammikā nu kho sā, bhante, saṅghasāmaggī”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:6.1.3.eng: “Sir, if the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, hasn’t been decided by the Sangha, hasn’t been resolved by the Sangha, yet the Sangha unifies the Sangha—is that unity in the Sangha legitimate?”

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.4.pli: “Yasmiṃ, upāli, vatthusmiṃ hoti saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, saṅgho taṃ vatthuṃ avinicchinitvā amūlā mūlaṃ gantvā saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti, adhammikā sā, upāli, saṅghasāmaggī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:6.1.4.eng: “That unity in the Sangha is illegitimate.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.5.pli: “Yasmiṃ pana, bhante, vatthusmiṃ hoti saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, saṅgho taṃ vatthuṃ vinicchinitvā mūlā mūlaṃ gantvā saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti, dhammikā nu kho sā, bhante, saṅghasāmaggī”ti?
pli-tv-kd10:6.1.5.eng: “If the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, has been decided by the Sangha, has been resolved by the Sangha, and the Sangha then unifies the Sangha—is that unity in the Sangha legitimate?”

pli-tv-kd10:6.1.6.pli: “Yasmiṃ, upāli, vatthusmiṃ hoti saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, saṅgho taṃ vatthuṃ vinicchinitvā mūlā mūlaṃ gantvā saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti, dhammikā sā, upāli, saṅghasāmaggī”ti.
pli-tv-kd10:6.1.6.eng: “That unity in the Sangha is legitimate.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.1.eng: “And sir, how many kinds of unity in the Sangha are there?”

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.2.eng: “There are two kinds of unity in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.3.eng: There’s the unity in the Sangha where the wording is fulfilled, but not the purpose.

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.4.pli: atthupāli, saṅghasāmaggī atthupetā ca byañjanupetā ca.
pli-tv-kd10:6.2.4.eng: And there’s the unity in the Sangha where both the wording and the purpose are fulfilled.

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.5.pli: Katamā ca, upāli, saṅghasāmaggī atthāpetā byañjanupetā?

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.6.pli: Yasmiṃ, upāli, vatthusmiṃ hoti saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, saṅgho taṃ vatthuṃ avinicchinitvā amūlā mūlaṃ gantvā saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti, ayaṃ vuccati, upāli, saṅghasāmaggī atthāpetā byañjanupetā.
pli-tv-kd10:6.2.6.eng: If the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, hasn’t been decided by the Sangha, hasn’t been resolved by the Sangha, yet the Sangha unifies the Sangha, this is called unity in the Sangha where the wording is fulfilled, but not the purpose.

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.7.pli: Katamā ca, upāli, saṅghasāmaggī atthupetā ca byañjanupetā ca?

pli-tv-kd10:6.2.8.pli: Yasmiṃ, upāli, vatthusmiṃ hoti saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho vivādo saṅghabhedo saṅgharāji saṅghavavatthānaṃ saṅghanānākaraṇaṃ, saṅgho taṃ vatthuṃ vinicchinitvā mūlā mūlaṃ gantvā saṅghasāmaggiṃ karoti, ayaṃ vuccati, upāli, saṅghasāmaggī atthupetā ca byañjanupetā ca.
pli-tv-kd10:6.2.8.eng: If the basis for the arguments and disputes in the Sangha, for the schism, fracture, and separation in the Sangha, has been decided by the Sangha, has been resolved by the Sangha, and the Sangha then unifies the Sangha, this is called unity in the Sangha where both the wording and the purpose are fulfilled.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upāli uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-kd10:6.3.1.eng: Upāli then got up from his seat, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and spoke to the Buddha in verse:

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.2.eng: “In regard to the duties and discussions of the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.3.eng: In regard to the business that arises and the investigations—

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.4.eng: A person of great value, how does he handle these?

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.5.eng: How is a monk fit to deal with these?”

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.7.eng: Watching his own behavior, with senses well-restrained—

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.8.eng: His enemies cannot legitimately criticize him;

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.9.pli: Na hissa taṃ hoti vadeyyu yena naṃ.
pli-tv-kd10:6.3.9.eng: There’s nothing for them to correct in him.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.12.eng: Without fear, he doesn’t tremble in a gathering;

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.13.eng: He doesn’t neglect the meaning and speaks naturally.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.14.eng: If then asked a question in a gathering,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.15.pli: Na ceva pajjhāyati na maṅku hoti;

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.16.eng: His words are timely and pertinent;

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.17.eng: He watchfully satisfies a discerning gathering.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.20.eng: Able to investigate, clever in discussion,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.21.comm: Sp 3.477: Viraddhikovidoti viraddhaṭṭhānakusalo, “Viraddhikovido: skilled in the cases of failure.” That is, the failure of his opponents.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.22.eng: Wherever his opponents turn, he refutes them,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.25.eng: Yet answers questions without hurting anyone.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.26.eng: He’s capable of acting as messenger,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.27.pli: Saṅghassa kiccesu ca āhu naṃ yathā;
pli-tv-kd10:6.3.27.eng: And about the business of the Sangha, they speak to him.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.28.eng: When speaking, or sent out by the community of monks,
pli-tv-kd10:6.3.28.comm: Sp 3.477: Karaṁ vacoti vacanaṁ karonto, “Karaṁ vaco: when doing speech.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.30.eng: As far as the actions by which one commits offenses,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.32.eng: Both these analyses he has learned well.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.33.eng: He’s skilled in the ways of clearing offenses.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.34.eng: If one is sent away for one’s conduct,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.35.eng: But once sent away one acts rightly,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.36.eng: There’s readmittance for one who lives thus.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.37.eng: This too he knows, the one skilled in analysis.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.39.eng: Yet whether junior, senior, or of middle standing,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.40.eng: The wise practice for the benefit of the many—

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.41.eng: Such a monk is fit to deal with these.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.42.eng: The tenth chapter on those from Kosambī is finished.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.45.eng: When disputing for not seeing an offense;

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.46.eng: One should not eject for just any offense,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.47.eng: One should confess an offense out of faith.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.48.eng: Just there inside the monastery zone,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.60.eng: No-one is to give their consent,

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.63.eng: Harmonious in the Teaching of the Victor.”

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.64.eng: The chapter connected with Kosambī is finished.

pli-tv-kd10:6.3.66.eng: The canonical text of the Great Division is finished.
